Somatic Variant Details - Potentially Ac.description: BCL11B encodes a C2H2-type zinc finger protein that functions as a transcriptional repressor and plays a role in T-cell development and survival. Loss of function mutations, copy number loss, and fusions resulting in the underexpression of BCL11B are associated with cancer progression.

BCL11B encodes a C2H2-type zinc finger protein that functions as a transcriptional repressor and plays a role in T-cell development and survival. Loss of function mutations, copy number loss, and fusions resulting in the underexpression of BCL11B are associated with cancer progression.

Somatic Variant Details - Biologically R.description: ARID2 encodes a protein that is a subunit of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex SWI/SNF-B or PBAF. This complex functions in ligand-dependent transcriptional activation. Loss of function mutations and copy number loss of ARID2 are associated with cancer progression.

RBM10 encodes a protein that contains a RNA-binding motif and interacts with RNA homopolymers, and is thought to function in regulating alternative splicing. Loss of function mutations and copy number loss of RBM10 are associated with cancer progression.

ARID2 encodes a protein that is a subunit of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex SWI/SNF-B or PBAF. This complex functions in ligand-dependent transcriptional activation. Loss of function mutations and copy number loss of ARID2 are associated with cancer progression.

RBM10 encodes a protein that contains a RNA-binding motif and interacts with RNA homopolymers, and is thought to function in regulating alternative splicing. Loss of function mutations and copy number loss of RBM10 are associated with cancer progression.

NFE2L2 acts as a transcription factor for proteins that contain an antioxidant response element (ARE) within their promoter sequence. Genes that contain ARE are involved in injury and inflammation response. Activating mutations and overexpression of NFE2L2 are associated with cancer progression.
